abstract: "It was damp and cold as Anthony Shadid and I crossed in darkness over the barbed-wire fence that separated Turkey from Syria last month. We were also crossing from peace into war, into the bloodiest conflict of the Arab Spring, exploding just up the rocky and sparsely wooded mountain.'' So begins Tyler Hicks's account of his final journey with Anthony, the acclaimed Times reporter, who died on that trip.

headline.main: Bearing Witness in Syria: A War Reporter's Last Days
